definition: to look for employment/to pick a quarrel
to try to find/to look for/to call on sb/to find/to seek/to return/to give change

sentences.english: "He would look for something, " he thought.
The next day she asked him about his venture.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，她问他找事做的情况。

sentences.english: To-morrow he would go into the roaring down-town district and find work.
sentences.chinese: 明天他要到熙熙攘攘的商业区去找事做。

sentences.english: So you must be "hard to find fault, " Do not let the old brain idle.
sentences.chinese: 所以你一定要“没事找事”，不要让大脑老闲着。

sentences.english: Bad politician creates problems of the people.
sentences.chinese: 坏的政客无事找事，与民为敌。

sentences.english: There he pondered over places which he might look up.
sentences.chinese: 在那里，他考虑着可以去找事做的地方。

definition: to pick fault with/to spot the differences/to nitpick/to pick a quarrel/to find complaint with
to ask for trouble/to bring misfortune on oneself
(coll.) to cause trouble for sb/to inconvenience
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
to make trouble out of nothing
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to make a scene/to fool around/to behave foolishly
to make people feel even more stressed or annoyed (coll.)/to make traffic congestion even worse
to pick a quarrel/to find fault/nitpicking
variant of 惹是生非[re3 shi4 sheng1 fei1]
